Review from Melanie P.
1 friend 2 reviews
Melanie P.
Union County, NJ 2/15/2012 We love going out to dinner and trying new seafood restaurants. Hubby made reservations for V day at 8:00 p.m.
We typically go to Chart House for Vday (they are extremely organized) but we decided to try a new place.
The only negative aspect of the night was the customer service from the hostess' upon arrival we were told they were a little backed up but that it would only be a 20 min wait... she took my name down and said she had me and would call my name out because they ran out of buzzards. we are pretty understanding and understood it was busy. after all whats 20 minutes? I followed up after about 25 minuted to be sure she didn't forget me. she assured me she had me... 15 more minutes pass and this time my husband decided to follow up since a total of 40 minutes had passed. she told him we were next. Unfortunately all the young ladies in the front are not on the same page. they sat 4 more couples. at that point I was really frustrated. I approached the hostess and asked if she had any idea when we would be seated, she said we were NEXT lol so I said you said that 4 dinner parties ago! so she said OK I'LL SIT YOU NOW! (58 minute wait with reservations)
I was confused and relieved... How is it all of the sudden she could just sit me? As we walked to get seated she made a very distasteful comment. I was appalled!!! How dare she ruin our Valentines day??? She has very poor customer service skills and no class...
I immediately approached the manager who apologized and handled the situation smoothly. Our waiter was amazing! very tentative. and the food was delicious. LOVED the lobster bisque... and the stuffed shrimp was really good.
this is a scenario that was properly turned around. hopefully the young lady re visits her training. As far as the restaurant we loved the food!

Review from Brian U.
2 friends 62 reviews
Brian U.
Forest Hills, NY 6/19/2012 My folks still live in NJ but I've been living in NY for some time. We seem to have 4 or 5 common restaurants we go to in NJ for lunch and this was one of them.
We were here over the weekend. This place starts and ends with the view, which admittedly is very pretty.
The food itself is exceedingly average, considering the price point.
The service leaves something to be desired. We had a party of ten and 2 of us arrived early. We were waiting for our parents and extended family and wished to be seated so we can begin ordering appetizers for the family to not waste any time and once they arrived (which wound up being a few, short minutes later) they'd quickly be served food. The woman at the front instructed me that she couldn't seat us until the entire party was there. I reluctantly agreed but when we were eventually seated, the place was half-empty with nobody waiting! Rules for the sake of rules are utterly ridiculous. The woman who eventually seated us was pleasant.
Then we waited for ten minutes until someone finally greeted us at our table and asked us for drink orders. TEN. MINUTES. In a half-empty restaurant. But wait! Before she left to get our drinks, our waitress spent some good amount of time educating us on some ridiculous points/cash-back card that has some annual(?) fee. I graciously listened while she finished her speech, but starting off our dining experience with this sales pitch was ultimately tacky and lacking class.
The food came and went (nothing worth describing) and before we received our bill the waitress kindly asked us if we considered the points card to which I replied we were not. She then continued to ask if we're sure, beginning to list reasons why to sign up and I had to interrupt her to thank her but we weren't interested and she kind of stormed off. She also asked for the brochure back, which is weird because it was sitting on a table, wet from drinks, probably splashed by seafood/shellfish. It made me wonder if she was going to give that to another customer and how many times that same brochure was distributed (gross!).
I don't know why they don't advertise this card in the lobby or just give you one in the beginning and also with the bill. This would be far less intrusive and obnoxious.
I think it's time we crossed this place off our list of usual restaurants.

Joy K.
Bergen County, NJ 6/18/2012 I'm really not a person who complains or gives staff at any business a hard time...knowing how difficult it is to be working at any customer service oriented business. However, Crabhouse absolutely blew my mind and I could not ignore their unprofessional, rude demeanor.
I made reservations for my family, a party of 5, for 6pm. We arrived around 5:50 and waited around. As soon as we walked in, we were not greeted by the hostesses (3 of them) who were chatting away. I had to wait for them to finish their conversation which was irrelevant to anything work related. I finally told them that we had a reservation for a party of 5 and they said they would call us when our table was ready.
It was nearing 6:30 and I politely asked one of the hostesses at the stand when our table would be cleared and again let her know that I made a 6 oclock reservation. She said all the reservations were backed up so they would call us when our table was ready. About fifteen mins later I realized that most of the parties were seated, even ones who came in after us. So I asked them about our table again and the hostess apparently mixed my family up with another Asian group who had a party of 11. We didn't get a single apology. In fact, they made it seem like they didn't take the fault for it at all. They also did not accomodate us with a table even after this...I was extremely agitated at this point but let it go.
For the entire time we were waiting, an older blonde hostess with a bad attitude, continued to walk from the dining room back to the front of the restaurant and said the same thing every time..."Your table is being cleaned" Really, it takes 45 minutes to clean off a table? She did not apologize for the delay..not once. She did however, continue with defensive remarks. The worst part was that she continued to roll her eyes. You treat people with respect to get respect, so after this point I was no longer saying my please and thank yous.
About an hour into waiting (which was ridiculous especially because it was not even that busy, I had reservations, and apparently the wait for those without a reservation was an hour...so what was the point of making a reservation if I had to wait just as long) I overheard another party of 5 who just walked in, say that they did not have a reservation. Five minutes later, that party was seated. When I confronted the hostesses about the situation, they said the party must have had reservations. This is when my family walked out. When my dad finally told the older blonde hostess with the horrible attitude that we will not be eating here she snapped at us with an "Ok, fine", then walked away with another hostess ranting about us...even before we walked out of the restaurant
I regret not complaining to the manager but we were all so angry and frustrated at the moment that we had to walk out. Now, here I am writing this review to warn everyone about the staff at The Crabhouse.
I have never in my life been treated with such disrespect at a restaurant. The hostesses here all have HORRIBLE attitudes. (especially the older blonde woman) I really don't understand how this restaurant still gets business with its dysfunctional staff.

Cliffside Park, NJ 6/28/2012 If I could give this location less than one star I could, but Yelp does not allow. I actually had an event here and boy did I regret every penny that was spent. Unfortunately my mother had booked and made a deposit to have her 50th birthday here before I even saw the location. She was mesmerized by the views of NYC, which I can agree are beautiful, but the only attraction to this place. To start off, the price per person for the event we had was about $42(thats including the the taxes and tip). Now the space that they have for events has a beautiful view of the skyline but other than that it sucks. Its on the second floor, but the room is open and you can hear the restaurant below and visa versa. Because of this, we could not have a DJ or play loud music. For the banquet price that I payed, i could have had my event at the Chart House in Weehawken, which is much more accomadating, similar in pricing, and more privacy, which is what is expected for the price i was paying. throughout the planning of the event, the person we dealt with, Elsa, seemed somewhat nice. I had gotten somewhat annoyed when I had asked if I could go and decorate the night before and another banquet person, Amy, said it was fine. Later on when I had spoken to Elsa, she had an attitude about it and told me that I should have informed her. Sorry I was not aware that your staff does not communicate with eachother! This really pissed me off. There are nicer ways of stating things. The day of the event, Elsa seemed to be in a good mood and was attentive with the set up. But during the event she had a scowling face in the corner. Im not sure if it was because we had some people singing for my mother or because of our radio, which was playing music, since we could not have DJ. Her stupid scowling face made for an uncomfortable evening. She even had come up to us to turn down the music because it could be heard from downstairs, and when we had gone downstairs you could not hear anything besides the crowd. Besides Elsa, although the waiters were nice at the beginning, they were absolutely horrible. The plan I had purchased included coffee, soda, and tea. I only had gotten one cup of soda becuase the waiter was nowhere to be found or would ignore us at our table. Even my mother, the birthday girl, was ignored when she asked for coffee to drink with her cake. I had to stand up and go get the waiter to get her coffee and even when i asked he looked at me like I had two heads. The food, was absolutely horrible. I had ordered the steak, and it tasted like cardboard and the salad had no flavor. All in All, i absolutely hate this place and am still kicking myself for spending any money at this location. I advise people to stay away from this place like the plague and spend your money elsewhere. I could only wish that not a single person support them by spending money there and for them to go out of business. I know this sounds harsh, but I had such a horrible experience with them.

Bronx, NY 5/20/2012 As far as seafood goes, CH has decent food. Nothing spectacular. Food's good and so is the service, usually. What makes CH good is where it's located. Scenery is fantastic. After your done eating, you can stop by a multitude of shops, grocery store, liquor store.... you get the point. Not to mention walking on the River Walk. Nice and relaxing. Keep walking south past the apartments and condos, past the movie theatre and you come upon City Place. They also have a couple of restaurants at City Place. Trust me, it's better to leave your car parked @ Edgewater Commons and walk. Traffic on River Road on Saturdays is a huge headache.
Our target is Haagen Dazs. Great ice cream there.
CH is worth at least 1 visit. Before you know it, you'll be back again to enjoy eating, walking and relaxing.
Try not to get smashed at the bar there by Staples. Too much going on car wise. Not to mention cops. Not much for them to do but monitor traffic and the parking lot. It is Edgewater we're talkin about here. Not a whole lot to do but eat and hang out. Gets a little nuts at night with the hot rodders and sports bikes by Starbucks.

Jersey City, NJ 12/5/2011 Came here on a Friday night after work for a nice dinner to help combat a stressful day. The view of NYC is fantastic, but I don't go to restaurants for the views.
The food was awesome -- we ordered crab stuffed mushrooms to start, cooked perfectly and with an interesting remoulade sauce. For dinner, we split the Baltimore platter and the shellfish steamer. The Baltimore platter was fried shrimp, fried fish (fish&chips style), stuffed crab, crab cake and fries. everything was cooked well, and nothing was overly fried. All the seafood tasted fresh and of good quality. The steamer was mussels, clams, shrimp, sausage, corn&potatoes -- all was good, but my feeling was that they should have listed that the shrimp were eat&peel (I HATE PEELING SHRIMP!!!), and also the mussels were a bit small. Not bad tasting, just teeny tiny. The clams, on the other hand, were huge!
We split the bread pudding for dessert -- holy crap. So rich and filling! Service was great too -- very attentive.
I'd definitely come back to try some more things on the menu! Really good quality seafood :)

Montclair, NJ 8/16/2011 2 photos So, it was my first evening out with this amazing (looking and otherwise) girl I had just met 16 hours earlier. Being it had been an unexpected day of releasing much pent-up energy since the wee hours of meeting in the morn (blame it on the full moon,) it was good to get out and get some fresh air and much needed rejuvenation of good food. So we crossed the GWB to dip our toes into Edgewater for a spot she enjoys, yet I had never been.
There seemed to be a good number of people waiting for seating, but for some reason we didn't have to wait at all. Maybe it was because it was just the two of us. Maybe it was because we looked so good together...and tired...and in need of nourishing replenishment...
We were seated upstairs right next to the window (which I highly recommend.) After taking pictures of the view, and each other (I know, I know, but what do you want? It was the wrap up to our first date,) we ordered a couple glasses of wine, and decided on what to eat:
Appetizer: crab&shrimp stuffed mushrooms, baked with parmesan in a white wine sauce. (bangin!)
Her Entree: "Shrimp Madrid" sauteed shrimp with asparagus, tomatoes and spinach in a garlic butter, tossed with angel hair pasta. (pretty tasty.)
My Entree: "Snapper Milanese" parmesan crusted snapper topped with jumbo lump crab in lemon butter sauce, served with asparagus and a tasty vegetable/rice combination. (bigiddy-bangin! word is bond, son!)
The bread they had brought out beforehand was excellent as well. or maybe it was our famishedness...
It's just now dawning on me that we didn't get dessert. WTF? I ALWAYS get dessert! I was stuffed though. We both were. And really, the service was pretty slow. And we were ready to get out of there, nahmean? Dessert was waiting at the crib...

Philadelphia, PA 8/23/2011 1 Check-in Here The view is one of the most valuable assets this place has in terms of ambiance. It was even a ~*~dark and stormy night~*~ and everyone was commenting on how cool the lightning looked.
Not sure what other Yelpers are talking about with food coming to the tables cold or inattentive waiters. We had a party of seven and everyone's food was fresh. The only thing, though, it took so long for the people who ordered the steamers to eat because of opening the crab and peeling shrimp compared to the people who ordered knife-and-fork dishes. I recommend that everyone in the party coordinates what they want when they order, otherwise you might have a bunch of bored people sitting around talking while others (...like myself) voraciously attempt to quickly finish their pots of shellfish.
Besides the entrees, I loved the oysters from the raw bar. Considering how large our party was, I'd say that the food came out at a reasonable pace. They have a full bar, too, and the wine selection is pretty good. The whole place is clean, down to the bathrooms. If you're with one other person, I'd imagine it feels pretty intimate. The dim lights and the view make for a slightly upscale, but not overly pompous atmosphere. Coupled with a great selection of quality seafood, I'd say you're in for a solid experience.

New York, NY 6/2/2011 1 Check-in Here 2.5 stars
Started the night with mango sangria which was good - not too weak nor strong. Our server was nice but was MIA half the time (and forgot our order of salad).
They bring out sourdough bread which was nothing noteworthy. They're located right on the water so that alone sets a nice atmosphere. The restaurant itself is very simple and casual.
Appetizers: 1) Calamari: Meh. I've had better. 2) Spring rolls were okay.
Entrees: 1) Maryland Crab Vegetable Soup: it was good but rather small for the price. 2) 1/2 dozen East Coast Oysters. One was blue point which is an oyster I like, and I forgot what the other one was. You can't mess up this order too much? 3) Lobster tail: overcooked

New York, NY 12/30/2010 This place was disappointing! I live in the area and had been looking to stop by for some time. I recently went for an impromptu dinner and was thoroughly unimpressed.
To start, while the service is very genuine and friendly, it's not great. The wait for everything takes a while. I went on a weeknight, and there weren't too many parties there, however, service was simply slow. It took forever to get some water.
They start you off with a loaf of bread and butter which was delicious - until we cut through to the center and realized that the bread was still frozen inside. I don't think I've ever experienced that before. We kindly told the waitress about the bread and she was apologetic, but we didn't ask for another loaf.
We ordered a steak and the Snapper Milanese (topped with jumbo lump crab and a lemon butter sauce). Both were tasteless to mediocre. The steak was bland and rubbery. We first tried it without any sauce but was unimpressed with the meat that we decided to douse it in A1. The snapper was heavily breaded for fish. I asked for the butter sauce on the side, but they forgot to bring it out, and I didn't want to wait around for it so I just ate it. The fish was very bland and soggy, with way too much breading. The sides were bland as well...
Overall, nothing stood out. Oh, except the fish tacos! Those were pretty good - I do recommend the fish tacos, and I would probably stick to just apps and drinks if I ever revisit this place again.

Edgewater, NJ 2/11/2008 This restaurant definitely has great views of the city and is a popular spot, as is evidenced by the always full parking lot. The bar is also a big hit for the locals, at one point, myself included. So, my review is primarily for the happy hour, which I was surprised to see ran from noon to 7PM. That's a lot of drinking time! My friend and I were big fans of the Bloody Mary (garnished with shrimp) and the half priced martinis (I was in such a green appletini phase back then!). I think they were $2.75 or $3.00 ... talk about VALUE!.
The bar food was very good and super economical: chicken wings, clams rockefeller, shrimp cocktail and the like were all very tasty. I think all bar specials during happy hour were $2.99 for each portion (6). They also feature an AYCE seafood bar with king crab legs, shrimp, various other seafood ... but I have never tried it. I have had the crabcakes which were average.
All in all, the Crab House can be a good value and I have heard from friends, that this is a good place for kids. Don't come here looking for extraordinary seafood as this is a chain after all. But then again, I don't like Legal Seafood either and many people swear by that chain.

New York, NY 7/11/2008 I've always liked going here when I was younger for a nice big crab dinner and great view of the bridge and Manhattan... While that's been replaced by other places for me now, I stopped by the Crab House before a movie to check out their happy hour, and was really well impressed.
All appetizers are half off, as are the drinks. That means beers for $3, flavored martinis for $4, well drinks for $4. It was all a really great deal.
The food was pretty good - calamari was standard, the crab dip was nice and a generous portion, the coconut shrimp was tasty though there were only 4, and the oysters on the halfshell were the only disappointment in that they were way too salty and tasted as if maybe they weren't cleaned with the utmost of care.
Overall, I got a couple of drinks and stuffed with food for $20, so that is enough for a good review and a return visit from me.

Chicago, IL 1/12/2009 A platter which sounded good on the menu was disappointing: gritty stuffed crab, greasy, floppy battered fish, funky tasting shrimp (tasted like they were fried in really dirty oil), and a fishcake which combined all the unpleasant qualities of the previous items (to recap: gritty, greasy, floppy, and funky-tasting). The dungeness crab was nothing special, the bread was sourdough at its chewiest (seemed like another 10 mins baking time may have helped), and two small glasses of different unpleasant wines were over $7 each.
In its partial defense, we did visit the Crab House at 3pm on a Saturday, and were one of three groups in the large space. Still, if you can't keep food standards up all day, don't stay open all day. The view of Manhattan would be amazing on a clear day. Service was attentive, if a little creepy. Wouldn't go again.
